meanings.definition: A unit of work or energy equal to the work done by a force of one dyne acting over a distance of one centimeter.
meanings.sent1: She measured the energy in the system using erg as the unit.
meanings.sent2: The scientist calculated the work done in erg for the experiment.
meanings.sent3: The tiny creature could only generate a few erg of energy, but it was enough for its needs.
meanings.sent4: Her determination to finish the race was like a surge of erg propelling her forward.
meanings.sent5: The glow of the fireflies in the night sky seemed to dance with the energy of a thousand erg.

meanings.definition: A unit of power equal to 10^-7 watts.
meanings.sent1: The device consumed power at a rate of one erg per second.
meanings.sent2: The solar panel produced electricity measured in erg.
meanings.sent3: The old flashlight could only emit a dim light due to its low erg power.
meanings.sent4: His voice boomed through the room with an erg of authority that demanded attention.
meanings.sent5: The engine roared to life with the power of a thousand erg, propelling the car forward.
